channel.description: Recent content in blog on codedinsugar

item.title: From http.server with love
item.description: Darling Moneypenny, you know I never even look at another woman.. -James Bond So we layed out the plan here, and now we action it. Let’s just jump right into it Here’s what we’re working with: $ tree . ├── Dockerfile ├── README.md └── src ├── httpsrv.py └── index.html Obviously the fun bits are going to be in httpsrv.py: from http.server import HTTPServer, BaseHTTPRequestHandler listenPort = 9292 class MyServer(BaseHTTPRequestHandler): def do_GET(self): if self.

item.title: httPyze - a Python model for secretProject
item.description: Everything has beauty, but not everyone sees it. -Confucius Python how I love thee, let me count the ways In a recent social engagement, the topic of discussion was Python. Somewhere in the middle of the conversation I said something along the lines of “I love Python, been reading it for years, wish I could write more of it everyday”. Then it dawned on me, why don’t I write Python everyday?

item.title: How'd I Get Here? GitHub + Hugo + Namecheap
item.description: A man has no name. -Jaqen H’ghar I consider myself a private person, especially my digital persona. I don’t do social media. The last public internet presence I updated was probably my LinkedIn account some 10 years ago and a short-lived MySpace account almost 20 years ago. Surprisingly my Flickr account is still active and I’ll ask an occassional question on Reddit but that’s about it. Call me old-skool but I prefer to keep my interactions in-person.

item.title: Blog Roadmap
item.description: Before the score comes the goal July 2022 Intro posts August 2022 Configure a light|dark|colored mode September 2022 Add a custom logo and a main page image October 2022 Persist the navigation menu (current styling auto hides it) November 2022 Maintain a one post per week minimum standard December 2022 End of year wrap up
